channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ongoing Fly-tipping at the End of Briset Road, 24th December
item.description:
Dear Royal Borough of Greenwich Council, I am writing to formally report a long-standing and ongoing fly-tipping issue at the end of Briset Road. This problem has persisted for several years and has now reached an unacceptable level. Individuals routinely dump large items of furniture as well as daily household waste in this area. Despite occasional clearances, the dumping continues without interruption, causing rubbish to accumulate repeatedly. The situation has become unbearable for local residents and presents serious concerns regarding public health, environmental damage, and the general safety and cleanliness of the neighbourhood. The continued failure to prevent or adequately address this issue has had a significant negative impact on residents’ quality of life. The area is regularly left in an unsanitary and unsightly condition, attracting further dumping and anti-social behaviour. I urge the Council to take immediate and effective action to resolve this matter permanently. This may include increased enforcement, monitoring, preventative measures, and any other steps necessary to stop illegal dumping at this location. Temporary clean-ups alone are clearly insufficient, given the long history of this problem. I would appreciate confirmation that this report has been received and information on what actions will be taken to address this ongoing issue. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Briset Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Graffiti on north-facing wall on Windsor Walk. It is extensive and looks like it will soon be 'filled in', It has appeared over the last several days and there is more nearby (which I have reported).

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 24th December
item.description:
A white Volkswagen with registration LS62 JYZ has been parked on Knoll Road, Bexley (DA5 1AY) for over a week. The vehicle appears to have front-end damage and has not been moved during this time. No one has attended the vehicle, and it appears to be abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knoll Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paranormal investgstors at night, 24th December
item.description:
A pair of genuinely self appointed Ghostbusters have been visiting the park within Watermens Square way beyond the official closing time. They are using bright floodlights and electrical equipment. In one incident last night they were on a residents doorstep and when asked refused to move. I asked them at 10pm to leave but they refused rudely. What action can be taken
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exposed Electrical Components in Streetlight Column, 24th December
item.description:
The access panel at the base of a streetlight column is missing or open, leaving internal electrical components and wiring fully exposed. This presents a potential safety hazard to pedestrians, particularly children, and may also pose a risk of water ingress or vandalism-related damage. The issue is located on a pedestrian island at a road junction and should be inspected and secured as a priority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westgate Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near 53 Hollycroft Avenue, 24th December
